options: Integrate functional testing as part of AWS deployment
Deploy the application to multiple locations
explanation:
By dividing the monolithic application into microservices, the
company is implementing a design where services operate independently,
ensuring they can scale and evolve without affecting other parts of the
application. This aligns with the principle of loosely coupled dependencies.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Functional testing is important but not directly tied to microservices
design.
B. Automation helps with deployment but isn't the primary focus in
this scenario.
C. Multiple locations typically refer to fault tolerance rather than
microservices design.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/well-architected/

question: A company wants to audit its password and access key rotation details for compliance. Which AWS service or tool can the company use to meet this requirement?
explanation:
The IAM credential report provides details about IAM users, including
password and access key status, which helps with auditing and compliance.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. IAM Access Analyzer is used for policy analysis.
B. AWS Artifact provides compliance reports but not credential
details.

D. AWS Audit Manager helps with auditing but is not specifically for
credential details.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_getting-report.html

question: A company wants to be alerted when a specific AWS cost threshold is reached. Which AWS services or tools can meet this requirement? (Choose two.)
explanation:
AWS Budgets can set thresholds for cost alerts, and Amazon
CloudWatch can create alarms for billing metrics.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon SQS is used for message queuing, not cost alerts.
C. Cost Explorer helps analyze spending but does not send alerts.
E. The Cost and Usage Report provides data, not real-time alerts.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cost-management/latest/userguide/budgets-managing-costs.html

question: Which AWS service or resource provides responses to the most commonly asked security-related questions from AWS users?
explanation:
The AWS Knowledge Center offers answers to frequently asked
questions, including security topics, to help users with common inquiries.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Artifact is for retrieving compliance reports.
B. Amazon Connect is a customer service tool.
C. AWS Chatbot enables interaction with AWS services via chat but
does not provide FAQs.


Reference: https://repost.aws/knowledge-center

question: Which tasks are customer responsibilities, according to the AWS shared responsibility model? (Choose two.) buckets.
options: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall.
Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.
Determine which Availability Zones to use for Amazon S3
Select Amazon EC2 instances to run AWS Lambda on.
correct_answers: Configure the AWS provided security group firewall.
Classify company assets in the AWS Cloud.
explanation:
According to the AWS shared responsibility model, customers are
responsible for tasks related to securing their data and configuring security
controls, such as managing security groups and classifying assets. AWS
manages the infrastructure, while customers handle tasks such as configuring
security settings and asset management.

Why other options are incorrect:
C. Determine which Availability Zones to use for Amazon S3 buckets
– AWS handles data redundancy and availability for S3.
D. Patch or upgrade Amazon DynamoDB – AWS manages patching
for managed services like DynamoDB.
E. Select Amazon EC2 instances to run AWS Lambda on – AWS
handles infrastructure for Lambda; instance selection is not required.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model

question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Choose two.)
explanation:
The AWS Well-Architected Framework consists of five pillars,
including Reliability and Operational Excellence. These pillars guide best
practices in designing and managing cloud architecture for efficiency,
performance, and resilience.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Availability – Although important, it is not one of the five Well-
Architected Framework pillars.
C. Scalability – While a design goal, it is not listed as a core pillar.
D. Responsive design – Refers to user interface design, not a
framework pillar.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/architecture/well-architected

question: Which AWS service provides a virtual network that closely resembles a traditional network within a data center, including security groups, network ACLs, and subnets?
explanation:
Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) enables customers to create a
virtual network in the AWS cloud that closely resembles a traditional
network within a data center. It includes customizable security settings, such
as security groups, network access control lists (ACLs), and subnets,
allowing customers to define network configurations and enforce security
boundaries.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS Direct Connect – Provides a dedicated network connection
from on-premises to AWS, not a virtual network.
C. Amazon CloudFront – A content delivery network for distributing
web content globally, not a virtual network service.
D. AWS Transit Gateway – Connects VPCs and on-premises networks,

but does not create a virtual network.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/vpc

question: Which AWS service is specifically designed to help users review and reduce their overall AWS spending by providing detailed cost analysis and resource utilization insights?
explanation:
AWS Cost Explorer allows users to view and analyze their AWS
spending over time. It provides detailed insights into costs and usage patterns,
helping customers optimize spending by identifying cost-saving opportunities
and forecast future costs.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Trusted Advisor – Provides recommendations on best
practices, including cost optimization, but is not dedicated to cost analysis.
C. Amazon CloudWatch – Monitors resource performance and
operational metrics but does not offer detailed cost insights.

D. AWS Budgets – Allows setting custom cost and usage thresholds,
but it doesn’t provide the detailed analysis features of AWS Cost Explorer.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-explorer

question: Which AWS service helps customers automate the deployment and scaling of applications by managing server instances and balancing traffic across them?
explanation:
AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a fully managed service that simplifies the
deployment and scaling of applications. It automatically handles the
provisioning of resources, load balancing, and scaling, allowing developers to
focus on code rather than infrastructure.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling – Manages the scaling of EC2 instances
but does not provide full deployment management.
C. Amazon S3 – A storage service, not designed for application
deployment.
D. AWS Lambda – Runs code in response to events without managing
server infrastructure, but it is not used for traditional application deployment.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/

question: Which AWS service provides a fully managed, scalable, and highly available DNS (Domain Name System) web service to route end-user requests to internet applications?
explanation:
Amazon Route 53 is a scalable DNS service that routes end-user
requests to applications by translating domain names into IP addresses. It
provides high availability and low latency for internet applications and offers
additional features like health checks and domain registration.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS Global Accelerator – A networking service that improves
application availability and performance globally, but does not provide DNS
services.
C. Amazon CloudFront – A content delivery network (CDN) that
caches and delivers content, but it does not provide DNS routing.
D. AWS Direct Connect – A service for establishing dedicated network
connections from on-premises to AWS, not a DNS service.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

question: Which AWS service allows you to manage and monitor access to AWS resources by providing fine-grained access control to services and resources?
explanation:
AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) allows you to create
and manage users, groups, and permissions to control access to AWS
resources. With IAM, you can set fine-grained access control policies,
ensuring that only authorized users can access specific services and
resources.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS CloudTrail – Provides logging and monitoring of API calls
made on AWS services, but does not manage access control.
C. Amazon GuardDuty – A threat detection service that continuously
monitors for malicious activity but does not manage access control.
D. AWS Shield – A service that protects applications from DDoS
attacks, not focused on managing access control.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/iam/

question: Which AWS service is designed to simplify the process of deploying machine learning models for real-time predictions?
explanation:
Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that simplifies the
process of building, training, and deploying machine learning models at
scale. It allows for easy deployment of models for real-time predictions,
helping users take advantage of machine learning without managing the
underlying infrastructure.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS Lambda – Runs code in response to events but does not
specifically focus on deploying machine learning models.
C. Amazon Polly – Converts text into lifelike speech, not related to
deploying machine learning models.
D. AWS IoT Core – Facilitates the connection of IoT devices to AWS
services but is not designed for deploying machine learning models.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/

question: Which of the following is an advantage that users experience when they move on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud? centers hardware providers
options: Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data
Price discounts that are identical to discounts from
Distribution of all operational controls to AWS
correct_answers: Elimination of expenses for running and maintaining data
explanation:
When users move on-premises workloads to the AWS Cloud, they no
longer need to invest in and maintain physical data centers. This reduces
capital expenses and associated maintenance costs, allowing them to focus on
other business priorities.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Price discounts that are identical to discounts from hardware
providers – AWS pricing structures differ from traditional hardware

providers.
C. Distribution of all operational controls to AWS – Customers still
retain some operational responsibilities under the shared responsibility
model.
D. Elimination of operational expenses – AWS reduces certain
operational costs, but some expenses remain, such as data transfer and service
usage.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/what-is-cloud-computing/

question: A company wants to manage deployed IT services and govern its infrastructure as code (IaC) templates. Which AWS service will meet this requirement?
explanation:
AWS Service Catalog allows organizations to manage a catalog of
approved IT services and govern infrastructure as code (IaC) templates. It
helps companies centrally manage commonly deployed AWS resources and
standardize configurations across accounts, ensuring compliance and
governance.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Resource Explorer – Helps search for resources across
accounts and Regions but does not manage IaC templates.
C. AWS Organizations – Manages multiple AWS accounts under a
single organization but does not focus on managing IaC templates.

D. AWS Systems Manager – Provides operational management tools
but does not specialize in governing IaC templates.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/servicecatalog/

question: Which AWS service or tool helps users visualize, understand, and manage spending and usage over time?
explanation:
AWS Cost Explorer is a tool that enables users to visualize,
understand, and manage their AWS spending and usage over time. It provides
detailed insights into cost trends, usage patterns, and allows users to forecast
and optimize their expenses.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Organizations – Manages and consolidates billing across
multiple accounts but does not provide detailed spending analysis.
B. AWS Pricing Calculator – Estimates costs for AWS services but
does not track actual usage and spending over time.
D. AWS Service Catalog – Manages approved IT services but does not
offer cost management or usage tracking.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-explorer/

question: A company is using a central data platform to manage multiple types of data for its customers. The company wants to use AWS services to discover, transform, and visualize the data. Which combination of AWS services should the company use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
explanation:
AWS Glue is a fully managed ETL (extract, transform, load) service
that helps discover, catalog, and transform data. Amazon QuickSight is a
business intelligence service that enables users to visualize data through
interactive dashboards. Together, these services allow the company to
manage, transform, and visualize data effectively.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) – Provides scalable file
storage but does not include data discovery, transformation, or visualization.
C. Amazon Redshift – A data warehousing service but does not
specifically focus on data transformation and visualization.
E. Amazon Quantum Ledger Database (Amazon QLDB) – A ledger
database for recording changes, not intended for data transformation or
visualization.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/glue https://aws.amazon.com/quicksight

question: A global company wants to migrate its third-party applications to the AWS Cloud. The company wants help from a global team of experts to complete the migration faster and more reliably in accordance with AWS internal best practices. Which AWS service or resource will meet these requirements?
explanation:
AWS Professional Services provides a global team of AWS experts
who help organizations accelerate cloud migrations and implement best
practices. They assist with complex projects, ensuring migrations are
completed faster and more reliably while following AWS best practices.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Support – Offers technical support but does not provide
dedicated migration assistance.
C. AWS Launch Wizard – Helps with automated deployments for
specific workloads but does not offer hands-on migration expertise.
D. AWS Managed Services (AMS) – Manages day-to-day operations
but does not provide direct migration guidance.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/professional-services/

question: An e-learning platform needs to run an application for 2 months each year. The application will be deployed on Amazon EC2 instances. Any application downtime during those 2 months must be avoided. Which EC2 purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
explanation:
On-Demand Instances are ideal for short-term, unpredictable
workloads as they allow flexibility without long-term commitments. For a 2-
month workload where downtime must be avoided, On-Demand Instances
provide reliability without the risks of interruption that come with Spot
Instances, and they avoid the cost commitment of Reserved Instances or
Dedicated Hosts.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Reserved Instances – Require a commitment of 1 or 3 years, which
is not cost-effective for a 2-month workload.
B. Dedicated Hosts – Provide dedicated hardware, which is costly and
unnecessary for short-term needs.
C. Spot Instances – Offer lower prices but can be interrupted, making
them unsuitable for applications needing high availability.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/

question: A company is storing sensitive customer data in an Amazon S3 bucket. The company wants to protect the data from accidental deletion or overwriting. Which S3 feature should the company use to meet these requirements?
explanation:
S3 Versioning allows multiple versions of an object to be stored in an
S3 bucket, protecting data from accidental deletion or overwriting. If an
object is deleted or updated unintentionally, previous versions can be easily
restored.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. S3 Lifecycle rules – Used to manage object storage lifecycle by
transitioning or expiring objects, but not specifically for protection against
accidental deletion or overwriting.
C. S3 bucket policies – Control access permissions but do not prevent
accidental overwriting or deletion of objects.
D. S3 server-side encryption – Encrypts data at rest but does not
prevent accidental deletion or overwriting.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/Versioning.html

question: Which AWS service provides the ability to manage infrastructure as code?
explanation:
AWS CloudFormation enables the management of infrastructure as
code by allowing users to define AWS resources in templates. This service
automates the provisioning and management of AWS resources, ensuring
consistent and repeatable deployments.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS CodePipeline – Manages CI/CD pipelines for application
code, not infrastructure as code.
B. AWS CodeDeploy – Automates application deployments but does
not handle infrastructure as code.
C. AWS Direct Connect – Provides a dedicated network connection to
AWS but is not related to infrastructure as code.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/

question: An online gaming company needs to choose a purchasing option to run its Amazon EC2 instances for 1 year. The web traffic is consistent, and any increases in traffic are predictable. The EC2 instances must be online and available without any disruption. Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?
explanation:
Reserved Instances offer a cost-effective solution for predictable,
consistent workloads with a commitment of 1 or 3 years. They provide
significant savings compared to On-Demand Instances and ensure continuous
availability, which is essential for applications requiring no disruption.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. On-Demand Instances – Suitable for short-term needs but more
expensive over a long term compared to Reserved Instances.
C. Spot Instances – Offer lower costs but can be interrupted, which is
unsuitable for workloads needing high availability.
D. Spot Fleet – Uses Spot Instances, which are not ideal for workloads
requiring continuous availability.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/reserved-instances/

question: A startup wants to minimize its initial infrastructure costs by paying only for the compute time it consumes. Which AWS service should the startup use to run its code without provisioning or managing servers?
explanation:
AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that allows users to run
code without provisioning or managing servers. It charges only for the
compute time used, making it cost-effective for startups that want to
minimize infrastructure costs.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon EC2 – Requires server provisioning and billing occurs even
when instances are idle.
C. Amazon RDS – A managed database service that incurs charges for
storage and uptime, even if not fully utilized.
D. AWS Fargate – Serverless for containers but still requires
configuration for containerized applications, whereas Lambda is ideal for
running simple functions without server management.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

question: Which AWS service allows users to review details of their AWS account activity, including information on which resources were accessed and by whom?
explanation:
AWS CloudTrail records AWS account activity and API calls,
providing details about who accessed resources, what actions were taken, and
when. This helps with monitoring and auditing activities within an AWS
account.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS Trusted Advisor – Provides recommendations to optimize
resources and improve security but does not track account activity.
C. Amazon CloudWatch – Monitors performance metrics but does not
log user activities.
D. AWS Config – Tracks configuration changes for AWS resources but
does not provide detailed user activity logs.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail

question: Which AWS service enables customers to consolidate and manage multiple AWS accounts under a single master account for billing and access control purposes?
explanation:
AWS Organizations enables customers to create and manage multiple
AWS accounts under a single master account, centralizing billing and access
management. This allows for streamlined account management and control
over access permissions across accounts.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Budgets – Allows users to set cost and usage budgets but does
not manage multiple accounts.
C. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) – Manages
permissions within a single account but does not handle multiple accounts.
D. AWS Billing and Cost Management – Provides billing and cost
analysis but does not consolidate multiple accounts.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/organizations

question: Which AWS service enables users to quickly deploy and manage a wide range of resources for applications by using infrastructure as code templates?
explanation:
AWS CloudFormation allows users to model and set up AWS
resources using infrastructure as code templates, providing a repeatable way
to deploy and manage resources quickly and consistently. It automates the
setup and provisioning of services specified in the template.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Elastic Beanstalk – Manages application deployment but is
limited to specific application environments rather than general infrastructure
management.
B. AWS CodePipeline – Orchestrates CI/CD pipelines for application
code but does not handle full infrastructure provisioning.
D. AWS OpsWorks – Configures and manages applications with Chef
or Puppet but lacks comprehensive infrastructure-as-code functionality.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/

question: Which AWS service is designed to automatically distribute incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as Amazon EC2 instances, to improve availability and reliability?
explanation:
AWS Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) automatically distributes
incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as EC2 instances,
containers, and IP addresses, within one or more Availability Zones. This
improves the availability, scalability, and fault tolerance of applications.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon CloudFront – A content delivery network that caches and
distributes content globally but does not distribute application traffic across
resources.
B. AWS Direct Connect – Provides a dedicated network connection to
AWS but does not handle traffic distribution.
D. Amazon Route 53 – Manages DNS but does not provide automatic
traffic distribution across multiple targets within an application.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

question: Which AWS service allows users to analyze and query large datasets stored in Amazon S3 using standard SQL?
explanation:
Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that allows users to
analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. It is serverless, meaning
users pay only for the queries they run, making it a cost-effective option for
analyzing large datasets.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon RDS – Provides managed relational databases but is not
used directly to query data in S3.
B. Amazon Redshift – A data warehousing service that requires data to
be loaded into the Redshift cluster, unlike Athena, which directly queries S3.

C. AWS Glue – A data integration service that prepares data for
analytics but does not provide SQL querying capabilities for S3 directly.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/athena/

question: Which AWS service helps protect applications from Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks?
explanation:
AWS Shield is a managed DDoS protection service that safeguards
applications running on AWS from DDoS attacks. It includes AWS Shield
Standard, which provides basic protection at no extra cost, and AWS Shield
Advanced for enhanced protection and detailed attack diagnostics.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS WAF – A web application firewall that protects against
specific web exploits but not directly from DDoS attacks.
C. Amazon GuardDuty – Provides threat detection and continuous
security monitoring but does not directly protect against DDoS attacks.
D. AWS Key Management Service (KMS) – Manages encryption keys
for secure data storage but is not related to DDoS protection.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/shield/

question: A company needs to quickly deploy, manage, and scale containerized applications on AWS without managing the underlying infrastructure. Which AWS service should the company use?
explanation:
AWS Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers that allows
users to run containerized applications without needing to manage the
underlying EC2 instances. It integrates with Amazon ECS and Amazon EKS,
enabling rapid deployment and scalability without infrastructure
management.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon ECS on EC2 – Requires managing the underlying EC2
instances, which adds complexity.
B. Amazon EC2 – Provides general-purpose compute but requires full
infrastructure management.
D. AWS Lambda – Ideal for running code in response to events but not
specifically designed for containerized applications.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/fargate

question: Which AWS service allows customers to centrally manage and automate backups across AWS services to help meet regulatory and business requirements?
explanation:
AWS Backup provides a centralized, automated solution for managing
backups across various AWS services. It simplifies data protection by
enabling users to define backup policies, monitor backup activity, and ensure
compliance with regulatory requirements.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Amazon S3 – Stores data and offers versioning but does not provide
a centralized backup management solution.
C. AWS CloudTrail – Tracks API calls and user activity but does not
perform backups.
D. AWS DataSync – Facilitates data transfers but does not manage or
automate backups.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/backup

question: Which AWS service enables customers to build applications that securely send, store, and receive messages between software components?
explanation:
Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a fully managed message
queuing service that enables reliable and secure communication between
software components. It decouples application components, allowing them to
send and receive messages asynchronously.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon EventBridge – Manages event-driven applications but is
primarily used for event routing, not message queuing.
C. AWS Step Functions – Manages workflows but does not provide
message queuing capabilities.
D. Amazon SNS – Provides a publish/subscribe messaging model but is
not designed for queuing and storing messages.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/

question: Which AWS service provides a scalable and managed relational database solution that automatically handles database patching, backups, and scaling?
explanation:
Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) is a managed database
service that automates administrative tasks such as database patching,
backups, and scaling. It supports several database engines like MySQL,
PostgreSQL, and Oracle.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Amazon DynamoDB – A fully managed NoSQL database, not
relational.
C. Amazon Aurora – A specific type of RDS that provides high
performance but is not a standalone service.
D. AWS Elastic Beanstalk – A platform-as-a-service offering for
deploying applications, not for managing databases.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/rds

question: Which AWS service allows customers to deploy and manage machine learning models without requiring deep machine learning expertise?
explanation:
AWS SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides tools to
build, train, and deploy machine learning models. It simplifies the process for
developers, even those with limited machine learning expertise, by offering
pre-built algorithms, automated model tuning, and one-click deployment.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Amazon Comprehend – A natural language processing service that
focuses on text analysis but does not cover the entire machine learning
lifecycle.
C. AWS Deep Learning AMIs – Pre-built environments for deep
learning but require expertise to use effectively.
D. Amazon Lex – A service for building conversational interfaces
(chatbots) but not for full machine learning model deployment.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/

question: Which AWS service provides a secure and scalable file storage solution that can be accessed by multiple EC2 instances simultaneously?
explanation:
Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) provides a scalable, elastic, and
secure file storage solution that can be mounted on multiple EC2 instances
simultaneously. It is designed for applications that require shared access to a
file system across multiple instances.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Amazon S3 – Object storage service, not a file system, and does not
support simultaneous access by multiple EC2 instances in the same way.
B. Amazon EBS – Block storage for individual EC2 instances, not
designed for concurrent access by multiple instances.
D. Amazon Glacier – Archival storage service intended for long-term
backup and retrieval, not for real-time file access.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/efs/

question: Which AWS service provides real-time monitoring and observability of AWS resources and applications?
explanation:
Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service for AWS resources and
applications in real time. It provides metrics, logs, and alarms, enabling users
to monitor the health and performance of their applications and infrastructure.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS CloudTrail – Logs API calls made on AWS resources,
primarily for security and compliance tracking, not for real-time monitoring.
C. AWS X-Ray – Provides tracing and debugging for applications, but
it is focused on analyzing and visualizing requests rather than full
infrastructure monitoring.
D. AWS Config – Tracks configuration changes and compliance over
time but does not provide real-time resource monitoring.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/

question: A company wants to migrate a large amount of on-premises data to AWS but is concerned about network bandwidth and transfer speed. Which AWS service should the company use to transfer the data securely and efficiently?
explanation:
AWS Snowball is a physical data transport solution that helps transfer
large amounts of data securely and efficiently. It is ideal for situations where
network bandwidth is insufficient for transferring large datasets over the
internet, as it allows data to be loaded onto a physical device and shipped to
AWS for uploading.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Direct Connect – Provides dedicated network connections but
is not a physical data transfer solution like Snowball.
C. AWS DataSync – A service for transferring data online over a
network but requires sufficient bandwidth and might not be suitable for very
large-scale data transfers in low-bandwidth environments.
D. Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration – Speeds up uploads to Amazon
S3, but it still relies on network bandwidth, which may not be ideal for very
large-scale data transfers in certain conditions.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/snowball/

question: Which of the following is a key benefit of using the AWS Cloud in terms of cost management and economics?
options: Unlimited free access to all AWS services
explanation:
The pay-as-you-go pricing model in AWS allows customers to only
pay for the resources they use, eliminating the need for upfront capital
expenses and ensuring that costs scale with usage. This model helps

businesses optimize their cloud costs by paying for what they consume
without long-term commitments.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Upfront capital expenses for resources – AWS avoids capital
expenses by offering flexible pricing, in contrast to traditional on-premises
infrastructure.
C. Fixed pricing for all services – AWS services have variable pricing
based on usage, not fixed prices for all services.
D. Unlimited free access to all AWS services – While AWS offers a
Free Tier, it has limits and is not available for all services.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/economics/

question: When comparing the cost structure of traditional on-premises infrastructure to AWS Cloud services, which of the following is a key advantage of AWS in terms of cost management?
options: Fixed costs for hardware and software
No need for any financial planning
Fixed costs for all cloud services
explanation:
AWS allows customers to pay for only the resources they use, with
costs that vary based on consumption. This is a significant advantage over
traditional on-premises infrastructure, where fixed costs for hardware,

software, and maintenance can be significant regardless of usage.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Fixed costs for hardware and software – Traditional on-premises
infrastructure typically involves fixed costs for hardware and software, unlike
the variable cost model of AWS.
C. No need for any financial planning – Financial planning is still
necessary in the AWS Cloud to optimize costs, but it is more flexible due to
the pay-as-you-go model.
D. Fixed costs for all cloud services – AWS services are priced based
on usage, meaning there are no fixed costs for all cloud services.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/economics/

question: Which AWS licensing strategy allows customers to bring their existing software licenses to the AWS Cloud to run on AWS infrastructure?
explanation:
The Bring Your Own License (BYOL) model allows customers to use
their existing software licenses in the AWS Cloud. This can be beneficial for
customers who have already purchased licenses for certain software and want
to continue using those licenses in AWS environments.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Pay-as-you-go licensing – In this model, customers pay based on
their usage of AWS services, not their own software licenses.
C. Subscription-based licensing – Involves paying for software
licenses on a subscription basis, typically including the license cost in the
AWS price.
D. License-included model – AWS services that come with the
software license included in the service cost, so customers don’t need to
manage their own licenses.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/simplified-byol-experience-using-aws-license-manager/

question: What is the primary benefit of "rightsizing" in the context of AWS Cloud resources? maximize performance patterns and reduce costs capacity scaling
options: Ensuring the use of the most expensive instance types to
Selecting the optimal resource sizes to match actual usage
Automatically scaling resources to the maximum available
Locking resources to a fixed size to prevent any future
correct_answers: Selecting the optimal resource sizes to match actual usage
explanation:
Rightsizing involves selecting the appropriate resource size based on
actual usage patterns, which ensures that customers are not over-provisioning
resources. This helps to optimize costs by avoiding the use of oversized
instances and paying only for the necessary capacity.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Ensuring the use of the most expensive instance types to maximize
performance – Rightsizing aims to optimize costs, not necessarily maximize

performance with expensive resources.
C. Automatically scaling resources to the maximum available capacity
– Rightsizing is about matching resources to actual needs, not automatically
scaling to the maximum.
D. Locking resources to a fixed size to prevent any future scaling –
Rightsizing focuses on flexible, efficient resource allocation, not locking
resources at a fixed size.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-optimization/right-sizing/

question: Which AWS service provides a managed Kubernetes platform that simplifies the deployment, management, and scaling of containerized applications?
explanation:
Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) is a fully managed service
that simplifies the deployment, management, and scaling of containerized
applications using Kubernetes. EKS handles the complexity of Kubernetes
setup and maintenance, allowing users to focus on building and deploying
applications.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) – ECS is another
container management service, but it uses a different orchestration system
(AWS proprietary, not Kubernetes).
C. AWS Lambda – AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service, not a
container orchestration service.
D. Amazon EC2 – EC2 provides virtual machines but does not manage
containerized applications in the way EKS does.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/eks/

question: In the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following is a shared responsibility between AWS and the customer? infrastructure
options: Managing physical security of data centers
Ensuring the protection of customer data
Operating and       maintaining    the     global   network
correct_answers: Ensuring the protection of customer data
explanation:
Under the AWS shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for
the security of the cloud infrastructure, while customers are responsible for
securing their data within the cloud. Both AWS and the customer share the
responsibility to protect the customer’s data by implementing appropriate
security measures, such as encryption.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Managing physical security of data centers – AWS is responsible
for the physical security of its data centers.
C. Patching the underlying hardware – AWS handles patching and
maintaining the hardware infrastructure.
D. Operating and maintaining the global network infrastructure –
AWS is responsible for operating and maintaining the global network
infrastructure.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

question: When using Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service), which of the following responsibilities does AWS take on compared to when using Amazon EC2? for Amazon RDS but not for EC2 RDS, while AWS handles the database security for EC2 for Amazon RDS, while the customer handles everything for EC2 database software for Amazon RDS and EC2
options: AWS manages the operating system and database software
The customer manages the database software for Amazon
AWS manages the operating system, patches, and updates
The customer manages both the operating system and
correct_answers: AWS manages the operating system and database software
explanation:
In the case of Amazon RDS, AWS manages the underlying operating
system, database software, and patches, allowing customers to focus on
managing the database itself. However, with Amazon EC2, the customer is
responsible for managing the operating system and software running on the
EC2 instances, including any database software.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. The customer manages the database software for Amazon RDS,
while AWS handles the database security for EC2 – In Amazon RDS, AWS
manages more aspects of the infrastructure, including the database software.
C. AWS manages the operating system, patches, and updates for
Amazon RDS, while the customer handles everything for EC2 – This is
accurate only for the comparison with EC2, but doesn't specify the database
aspect in detail.
D. The customer manages both the operating system and database
software for Amazon RDS and EC2 – In Amazon RDS, AWS manages the
operating system and database software, not the customer.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/rds/

question: A healthcare company must comply with industry regulations requiring data privacy and security for patient information. Which AWS resource can the company use to understand and ensure compliance across different geographic locations and industries?
explanation:
AWS Artifact provides access to AWS compliance reports and
certifications, helping customers meet industry-specific compliance
requirements, such as HIPAA for healthcare and GDPR for data privacy in
the EU. Customers can download and review these documents to ensure
compliance in various geographic locations and industries.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS CodePipeline – This service is used for CI/CD but is not
related to compliance reporting.
C. Amazon QuickSight – QuickSight is a data visualization service and
does not address compliance needs.
D. AWS X-Ray – AWS X-Ray is for tracing applications and is not
relevant to compliance documentation.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/artifact

question: Which AWS service helps customers improve the security and compliance of their workloads by automatically assessing Amazon EC2 instances and Amazon ECR container images for vulnerabilities?
explanation:
Amazon Inspector is an automated security assessment service that
scans Amazon EC2 instances and Amazon ECR container images for
software vulnerabilities and unintended network exposure. This service helps
customers identify security issues and improves compliance with security
best practices.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS Secrets Manager – Manages secrets securely but does not
assess vulnerabilities.
C. AWS CloudTrail – Tracks account activity but does not perform
security assessments.
D. AWS Config – Monitors resource configurations but does not assess
vulnerabilities.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/

question: Which AWS service provides a centralized dashboard to monitor, analyze, and manage security findings from various AWS services across an organization?
explanation:
AWS Security Hub aggregates and centralizes security findings from
multiple AWS services, such as Amazon GuardDuty, AWS Config, and
Amazon Inspector, into a unified dashboard. This enables customers to
monitor and assess their security posture, respond to potential threats, and
ensure compliance across their AWS environment.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS Shield – Provides DDoS protection but does not offer a

centralized security findings dashboard.
C. Amazon GuardDuty – Detects threats but doesn’t centralize findings
from multiple services.
D. AWS CloudTrail – Tracks account activity but does not aggregate
security findings from other services.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/security-hub/

question: Which AWS service helps detect malicious activity and potential threats in an AWS environment by analyzing account activity and network traffic?
explanation:
Amazon GuardDuty is a threat detection service that continuously
monitors AWS accounts, network traffic, and DNS logs to identify malicious
activity, unauthorized access, and other security threats. By analyzing data
from multiple sources, it helps customers detect and respond to potential
security incidents in their environment.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS Shield – Provides DDoS protection but does not analyze
network traffic for security threats.
C. AWS Security Hub – Aggregates security findings but does not
perform threat detection directly.
D. AWS Trusted Advisor – Offers best practices recommendations but
does not detect malicious activity.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/guardduty/

question: Which AWS service provides protection against Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks to help safeguard applications running on AWS?
explanation:
AWS Shield is a managed DDoS protection service that safeguards
applications running on AWS against DDoS attacks. AWS Shield Standard is
automatically included at no extra cost and defends against common network
and transport layer attacks. AWS Shield Advanced provides additional
protections and detailed attack diagnostics.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS WAF – Helps control access to applications by filtering traffic
but does not provide DDoS protection alone.
C. AWS Security Hub – Aggregates security findings but does not offer
DDoS protection.
D. Amazon GuardDuty – Detects threats but is not specifically focused
on DDoS protection.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/shield/

question: Which AWS feature provides encryption in transit to secure data as it moves between AWS services or over the internet?
explanation:
SSL/TLS (Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security) provides
encryption in transit by securing data as it moves between AWS services and
over the internet. This ensures data privacy and security when users access
AWS resources or applications hosted on AWS.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Key Management Service (KMS) – Manages encryption keys
for data at rest but does not directly provide encryption in transit.
C. Amazon Macie – Helps with data classification and data security but
does not provide encryption.
D. AWS CloudTrail – Monitors account activity for audit purposes but
does not provide encryption.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/what-is/ssl-certificate/

question: Which AWS service provides encryption at rest for data stored in Amazon S3, ensuring that data is automatically encrypted when stored?
explanation:
Amazon S3 Server-Side Encryption (SSE) automatically encrypts data
at rest in Amazon S3, ensuring that data stored within S3 buckets is
encrypted. It supports various encryption methods, including SSE-S3, SSE-
KMS, and SSE-C, allowing customers to choose the level of encryption they
need.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Key Management Service (KMS) – Manages keys for

encryption but does not directly perform encryption at rest.
C. AWS CloudHSM – Provides hardware security module (HSM)
services for key management, not specifically for data encryption at rest.
D. Amazon RDS – Provides encryption at rest for RDS databases, but
the service is specific to relational databases, not all AWS storage.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/UsingEncryption.html

question: Which AWS service helps automate the process of auditing and continuously evaluating the compliance of your AWS resources against industry standards and best practices?
explanation:
AWS Audit Manager automates the process of auditing and evaluating
the compliance of AWS resources against industry standards, regulations, and
best practices. It helps customers simplify the collection of evidence, evaluate
controls, and maintain continuous compliance across AWS environments.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS CloudTrail – Provides account activity logging and
monitoring but does not automate compliance audits.
C. AWS Config – Tracks resource configurations but does not perform
automated compliance evaluations.
D. AWS Security Hub – Aggregates security findings but is focused on
security posture rather than compliance audits.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/audit-manager/

question: Which AWS service provides a detailed view of the configuration of AWS resources, enabling users to track resource changes and assess compliance with internal policies?
explanation:
AWS Config provides detailed tracking of AWS resource
configurations, enabling users to monitor changes to resources over time. It
helps assess compliance with organizational policies and standards, allowing
users to track and audit resource configurations for governance and risk
management purposes.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS CloudTrail – Provides logs of API activity but does not track
resource configurations or changes over time.
C. AWS CloudFormation – Automates infrastructure provisioning
using templates but does not track configuration changes of resources.
D. AWS Systems Manager – Manages infrastructure and automation
but does not track resource configurations for compliance.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/config/

question: Which AWS service provides detailed access reports to help monitor and analyze who is accessing your AWS resources?
explanation:
AWS CloudTrail enables detailed access reporting by logging all API
activity across AWS services. It helps track who accessed AWS resources,
when they accessed them, and which actions they performed, providing a
comprehensive audit trail for security and compliance purposes.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) – Manages user
permissions and access policies but does not provide detailed access logs or
reports.
C. AWS Config – Tracks resource configuration changes and
compliance but does not provide access logs.
D. AWS Trusted Advisor – Provides best practice recommendations but
does not focus on access reporting.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

question: Which AWS service helps customers assess their workloads for compliance with specific industry standards, such as PCI-DSS or HIPAA?
explanation:
AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports
and certifications, helping customers assess their AWS workloads'
compliance with various industry standards, including PCI-DSS, HIPAA,
SOC 1, 2, and 3, and others. It provides resources necessary for meeting
compliance requirements in AWS.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS CloudTrail – Tracks API activity but does not provide
compliance reports or help with compliance assessment.
B. AWS Config – Monitors and records AWS resource configurations,
but does not focus on compliance reporting for industry standards.
D. AWS Security Hub – Aggregates and prioritizes security findings
but is not specifically focused on compliance reporting.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/artifact/

question: Which AWS service provides centralized logging to monitor and analyze AWS Cloud infrastructure and application logs in real time?
explanation:
Amazon CloudWatch Logs provides centralized logging to monitor,
store, and analyze log data from AWS services, applications, and on-premises
servers. It helps track performance, monitor security events, and troubleshoot
issues by analyzing logs in real time.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS CloudTrail – Logs API activity for auditing purposes but does
not manage or analyze application and system logs.
C. AWS Config – Tracks resource configurations and changes, but does
not provide real-time log analysis.
D. Amazon S3 – A storage service that can store logs but does not offer
centralized logging or real-time log analysis.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/logs/WhatIsCloudWatchL

question: Which AWS service allows customers to manage user access to multiple AWS accounts and business applications with a single set of credentials?
options: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)
correct_answers: AWS IAM Identity Center (AWS Single Sign-On)
explanation:
AWS IAM Identity Center (formerly AWS Single Sign-On) enables
customers to manage user access to multiple AWS accounts and cloud
applications using a single set of credentials. It simplifies user management
by integrating with corporate directories or external identity providers and
offers seamless access control across AWS environments.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS IAM – Manages user permissions within a single AWS
account, but does not offer multi-account or single sign-on capabilities.
B. AWS Directory Service – Provides directory services for integrating
on-premises directories with AWS, but does not handle single sign-on or
access across multiple AWS accounts.
D. AWS Cognito – Focuses on user authentication and authorization for
web and mobile apps, not for managing AWS account access.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/iam/identity-center/

question: Which AWS service is used to securely store and manage sensitive information, such as API keys, passwords, and database credentials?
explanation:
AWS Secrets Manager helps securely store and manage sensitive
information such as API keys, passwords, and database credentials. It also
allows automatic rotation of credentials and integrates with other AWS
services for enhanced security, reducing the need to hard-code credentials in
applications.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) – Manages
permissions and access control, but does not store or manage sensitive
credentials.
C. AWS Key Management Service (KMS) – Manages encryption keys
for data security but does not specifically store credentials.
D. AWS CloudTrail – Provides logging and monitoring of API activity
but does not store sensitive credentials.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/secrets-manager/

question: Which AWS service allows you to automate operational tasks across AWS resources and manage the configuration of your AWS infrastructure?
explanation:
AWS Systems Manager provides operational insights and tools for
automating common administrative tasks such as patching, configuration
management, and compliance across AWS environments. It helps manage
and configure AWS resources, offering a unified interface to control and
automate operations.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS CloudFormation – Focuses on provisioning and managing
infrastructure as code, not operational task automation.
C. AWS CloudTrail – Monitors and logs API calls made in an AWS
account, but does not manage operations or configurations.
D. Amazon EC2 Systems Manager – Refers specifically to EC2
instance management, whereas AWS Systems Manager applies to broader
AWS resource management.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/

question: Which AWS service allows you to add an extra layer of security to your AWS account by requiring a second form of authentication in addition to your password?
explanation:
AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) provides an extra layer of
security for your AWS account. It requires users to provide two forms of
authentication: something they know (password) and something they have
(an MFA device). This helps protect against unauthorized access even if the
password is compromised.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) – IAM is used for
managing users and permissions, but does not directly implement MFA.
C. AWS Key Management Service (KMS) – KMS is used for managing
encryption keys, not for multi-factor authentication.
D. AWS Shield – AWS Shield is a service for DDoS protection, not
related to MFA.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/iam/features/mfa/

question: Which AWS service helps manage centralized access to multiple AWS accounts and business applications, allowing users to sign in with a single set of credentials? Center
options: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) Identity
correct_answers: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) Identity
explanation:
AWS IAM Identity Center (formerly AWS Single Sign-On) enables
centralized management of user access across multiple AWS accounts and
business applications with a single set of credentials. It integrates with
corporate directories or identity providers to simplify user management and
enhance security.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS IAM – Manages user access and permissions, but does not
provide single sign-on capabilities across multiple accounts.
C. AWS Directory Service – Provides managed directories for
integrating on-premises Active Directory with AWS but does not offer the
same centralized access management as IAM Identity Center.
D. AWS Cognito – Used for user authentication and authorization in
mobile and web apps, but not for managing access to multiple AWS
accounts.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/iam/identity-center/

question: Which AWS feature allows a user from one AWS account to access resources in another AWS account by assuming a role with specific permissions?
explanation:
Cross-Account IAM Roles allow a user or service in one AWS account
to assume a role in another AWS account and gain the permissions defined in
that role. This is useful for granting access to resources without sharing
security credentials.
{
"Version": "2012-10-17",
"Statement": {
"Effect": "Allow",
"Action": "sts:AssumeRole",
"Resource": "arn:aws:iam::DESTINATION-ACCOUNT-ID:role/UpdateData"
}
}

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS IAM Policies – IAM policies define permissions for users,
groups, and roles, but do not facilitate access between accounts.
C. AWS Organizations – AWS Organizations is a service for
managing multiple AWS accounts, but it does not handle cross-account
access directly.
D. AWS Cognito – AWS Cognito is used for managing user
authentication in web and mobile applications, not for cross-account access.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/tutorial_cross-account-with-roles.html

question: Which AWS feature helps ensure that users and roles only have the minimum permissions necessary to perform their tasks, in compliance with the principle of least privilege?
explanation:
AWS Managed Policies are pre-defined IAM policies created and
maintained by AWS. These policies follow the principle of least privilege by
granting only the necessary permissions to perform specific tasks. Using
these policies helps ensure that users and roles have only the permissions
they need to minimize security risks.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. AWS IAM Roles – IAM roles define a set of permissions but do not
inherently ensure compliance with the principle of least privilege unless
combined with managed policies.
C. AWS IAM Identity Center – Used for centralized identity
management, not for enforcing least privilege through permissions.

D. AWS IAM Access Analyzer – Helps analyze and review IAM
policies for overly permissive access, but does not directly enforce least
privilege.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies_managed-vs-inline.html

question: Which AWS feature allows administrators to create policies that grant only the minimum necessary permissions to users, ensuring compliance with the principle of least privilege?
explanation:
AWS Custom IAM Policies allow administrators to define specific
permissions tailored to the needs of users, roles, or services. By creating
custom policies, organizations can apply the principle of least privilege,
ensuring that users and roles are granted only the permissions required for
their tasks.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Managed Policies – Managed policies are pre-defined by
AWS and might not always align with the exact minimal permissions
required for a specific user or role.
C. AWS IAM Identity Center – This service is for managing identity
and access across AWS accounts, not directly related to defining custom

permissions.
D. AWS Resource Access Manager – Used for sharing AWS resources
across accounts, not for managing permissions.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies.html

question: How can administrators ensure that users within a group are only granted the minimum permissions necessary to perform their tasks, in compliance with the principle of least privilege?
options: Attach IAM Managed Policies to the Group
Attach IAM Policies to individual users
Assign users to multiple IAM Groups
Use IAM Roles for group members
correct_answers: Attach IAM Managed Policies to the Group
explanation:
By attaching IAM Managed Policies to an IAM Group, administrators
can define the minimum necessary permissions for all members of the group,
ensuring compliance with the principle of least privilege. This approach
ensures users only have access to the resources they need to perform their job
functions.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Attach IAM Policies to individual users – While individual IAM
policies can control access, attaching policies directly to users might lead to
excessive permissions and inconsistency in managing access control.
C. Assign users to multiple IAM Groups – This could lead to overly
permissive access if the groups have different policies. It is better to carefully
manage group memberships and associated permissions.

D. Use IAM Roles for group members – IAM Roles are typically used
for services or temporary access, not for group management of user
permissions.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_groups.html

question: Which of the following tasks can only be performed by the AWS account root user?
explanation:
The AWS account root user is the only identity that has permission to
perform certain account-level tasks, including changing the AWS account
name. While IAM users and roles can manage resources and permissions,
only the root user can perform tasks such as changing the account name and
closing the account.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Creating IAM users – This task can be performed by IAM users
with the necessary permissions, not just the root user.
B. Modifying IAM policies – IAM users with appropriate permissions
can modify IAM policies, not just the root user.
D. Granting permissions to IAM roles – IAM users with the correct
permissions can grant roles permissions, so this is not exclusive to the root
user.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_root-user.html

question: Which of the following methods can help protect the AWS account root user from unauthorized access? (Choose two.)
options: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user
Apply an IAM policy that restricts root user access
Regularly rotate the root user’s access keys
Use strong, unique passwords for the root user
correct_answers: Enable multi-factor authentication (MFA) for the root user
Use strong, unique passwords for the root user
explanation:
Securing the AWS account root user is critical, as it has unrestricted
access to the account. Enabling multi-factor authentication (MFA) adds an
additional layer of security, while using a strong, unique password makes
unauthorized access more difficult. It is also recommended to avoid using
root user credentials for daily tasks and instead use IAM users with
appropriate permissions.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Apply an IAM policy that restricts root user access – IAM policies
cannot restrict the root user, as it has full permissions by default.
C. Regularly rotate the root user’s access keys – AWS recommends
avoiding the creation of root access keys; instead, use IAM users for access.
D. Delete the root user account – The root user cannot be deleted, as it
is essential for certain account-level tasks.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_root-user.html#id_root-user_security

question: Which of the following best describes federated identity management in AWS? access AWS resources within AWS permissions
options: Creating multiple IAM users in each AWS account
Enabling users from an external identity provider (IdP) to
Using AWS Directory Service to manage permissions
Allowing multiple AWS accounts to share roles and
correct_answers: Enabling users from an external identity provider (IdP) to
explanation:
Federated identity management allows users from an external identity
provider (IdP), such as corporate directories or social identity providers, to

access AWS resources without creating individual IAM users in AWS. By
using a trusted IdP, AWS can grant temporary credentials to external users,
enabling them to authenticate and assume roles for access.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Creating multiple IAM users in each AWS account – This describes
internal IAM user management, not federation.
C. Using AWS Directory Service to manage permissions within AWS –
AWS Directory Service can help manage permissions, but it is not specific to
federated access.
D. Allowing multiple AWS accounts to share roles and permissions –
This describes cross-account access, not federated identity management.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles_common-scenarios_federated-users.html

question: Which of the following statements are true about security groups in AWS? (Choose two.) instances. IP address, protocol, and port number. allowed inbound traffic are automatically allowed. allow all outbound traffic by default.
options: Security groups act as a virtual firewall for Amazon EC2
Security groups can block specific IP addresses.
Security groups allow inbound and outbound rules based on
Security groups are stateful, meaning that responses to
Security groups deny all inbound traffic by default and
correct_answers: Security groups act as a virtual firewall for Amazon EC2
Security groups are stateful, meaning that responses to
explanation:
Security groups function as virtual firewalls, controlling access to EC2
instances by specifying rules for inbound and outbound traffic. They are
stateful, so any response to an allowed inbound request is automatically
permitted outbound. By default, security groups block all inbound traffic and
permit all outbound traffic, and rules are configured based on protocol, port,
and IP range.

Why other options are incorrect:
B. Security groups can block specific IP addresses – Security groups
allow but do not have direct options to block specific IPs. Use network ACLs
for IP blocking.

C. Security groups allow inbound and outbound rules based on IP
address, protocol, and port number – Partially correct, but security groups
focus on "allow" rules only.
E. Security groups deny all inbound traffic by default and allow all
outbound traffic by default – While true, this does not fully address security
group functionality.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-security-groups.html

question: Which of the following statements are true about network access control lists (network ACLs) in AWS? (Choose two.) inbound traffic are automatically allowed outbound. inbound and outbound traffic. ACL, and by default, it uses the default network ACL. cannot block any.
options: Network ACLs are stateful, meaning responses to allowed
Network ACLs operate at the subnet level within a VPC.
Network ACLs support both "allow" and "deny" rules for
Each subnet in a VPC must be associated with a network
Network ACLs can only allow specific IP addresses but
correct_answers: Network ACLs operate at the subnet level within a VPC.
Network ACLs support both "allow" and "deny" rules for
Network ACLs support both "allow" and "deny" rules for
explanation:
Network ACLs provide an optional layer of security that acts at the
subnet level. Unlike security groups, network ACLs are stateless and allow
you to explicitly allow or deny traffic based on rules defined for both inbound
and outbound traffic. Every subnet is automatically associated with a default
network ACL, which can be customized or replaced.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. Network ACLs are stateful – Network ACLs are stateless, meaning

return traffic must be explicitly allowed in both inbound and outbound rules.
D. Each subnet in a VPC must be associated with a network ACL –
Correct, but this does not highlight the main characteristics of network ACLs.
E. Network ACLs can only allow specific IP addresses but cannot
block any – Network ACLs can include both "allow" and "deny" rules,
offering flexible traffic control.


Reference: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/vpc-network-acls.html

question: A company wants to protect its web applications from common web exploits that could affect application availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources. Which AWS service can be used to help achieve this?
explanation:
AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect web
applications or APIs from common web exploits, such as SQL injection and
cross-site scripting (XSS), by controlling access based on a set of
customizable rules. AWS WAF integrates with Amazon CloudFront,
Application Load Balancer, and API Gateway, allowing businesses to define
security rules for filtering web requests.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Shield – Provides DDoS protection but does not offer
customizable web security rules like AWS WAF.
C. Amazon GuardDuty – Monitors for malicious or unauthorized
activity but does not filter web traffic directly.
D. AWS CloudTrail – Tracks API activity but does not protect against
web application exploits.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/waf/

question: A company needs additional security tools to monitor and protect its AWS environment. Where can the company find third-party security solutions that are compatible with AWS services?
explanation:
AWS Marketplace is a digital catalog that allows customers to find,
purchase, and deploy third-party software solutions, including security
products, that are compatible with AWS. AWS Marketplace offers a wide
variety of security solutions, such as antivirus, firewall, and vulnerability
scanning tools, which can be integrated into an AWS environment to enhance
security.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Support – Provides assistance and guidance but does not offer
third-party software solutions.
C. AWS Cost Explorer – Helps visualize and manage costs but is not
related to security tools.
D. AWS Trusted Advisor – Offers security recommendations but does
not provide third-party software.


Reference: https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/

question: Where can AWS customers find answers to frequently asked questions and troubleshooting guides for common issues with AWS services?
explanation:
The AWS Knowledge Center is an online resource that provides
answers to frequently asked questions and offers troubleshooting guides for
common issues across a wide range of AWS services. It is accessible to all
AWS customers and helps users find quick solutions to common questions.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Support – Provides personalized support but does not offer a

searchable FAQ or troubleshooting library.
C. AWS Training and Certification – Offers training resources but is
not a primary source for troubleshooting FAQs.
D. AWS Service Catalog – Allows managing and deploying AWS
resources but does not provide FAQs or troubleshooting information.

question: Which AWS resource provides security best practices, compliance information, and updates about the latest security features available on AWS?
explanation:
The AWS Security Center is a centralized resource that provides
security best practices, compliance resources, and updates on the latest
security features available in AWS. It is designed to help customers
understand and implement strong security practices within their AWS
environment.

Why other options are incorrect:
A. AWS Trusted Advisor – Provides security recommendations for
specific resources but does not offer a centralized hub for AWS security
updates.
B. AWS Security Hub – Aggregates security findings from different
AWS services but does not provide general security best practices or
compliance information.
D. AWS Artifact – Provides access to AWS compliance reports and
agreements but does not contain general security best practices or updates.
